timeline.bodyText: There is no need for these Strings. Please use org.jabref.model.entry.field.StandardField#AUTHOR etc.
timeline.author: koppor

replies.bodyText: Yes, I got it. Thank you for giving the advice!
replies.author: ShikunXiong

timeline.author: koppor

timeline.bodyText: Can these become a parameter for the construtor at org.jabref.model.entry.field.StandardField?
timeline.author: koppor

timeline.bodyText: I would change that to: "Unique identifier for this entry".
timeline.author: koppor

timeline.bodyText: In case the tooltip is included int he StandardField, this whole mapping becomes obsolete.
timeline.author: koppor

replies.bodyText: I wouldn't put it in StandardField as this class is a logic/model class while the tooltip is a GUI-related thing. Thus, having such a mapping in the gui is fine.
replies.author: tobiasdiez

timeline.bodyText: These tooltips should be localized using Localization.lang and adding them to JabRef_en.prop.
timeline.author: tobiasdiez

replies.bodyText: Yes, this works. Thank you!
replies.author: ShikunXiong

timeline.bodyText:
Tests are failing because the l10n-key should be the same as the value.
E.g.: tip.setText(Localization.lang("Multiple authors separated with 'and', e.g. author1 and author2"));
timeline.author: calixtus

timeline.bodyText: Why do you use field.getName() as an argument even though you already set field as the first argument? Seems like an unnecessary duplication.
timeline.author: calixtus

replies.bodyText: You're right. I have changed it. Thank you
replies.author: ShikunXiong

timeline.author: calixtus

replies.bodyText:
I think you could use field as an argument for setTip and test field instead

Thank you for the suggestion. I have changed it.
replies.author: ShikunXiong

timeline.bodyText:
Compare field to StandardField.AUTHOR.
Forget about getName() at all. ;-)
Maybe put instanceof or a cast somewhere there.
timeline.author: calixtus

replies.author: ShikunXiong

replies.bodyText: Yes that's much better!
replies.author: Siedlerchr

replies.bodyText: Instead of the try catch, you can test field instanceof StandardField an then cast it to, so you don't have to check for the name. As I said: forget about getName(). :-)
replies.author: calixtus

replies.bodyText: Field also provides isStandardField()
replies.author: calixtus
ShikunXiong

replies.bodyText:
BibtexKey is InternalField.KEY_FIELD
You need to handle it separate.
replies.author: Siedlerchr

replies.bodyText: Got it. I'll try
replies.author: ShikunXiong
ShikunXiong

replies.bodyText: Please: variables lowercase
replies.author: Siedlerchr

replies.bodyText:
Please: variables lowercase

My fault. I have changed it.
replies.author: ShikunXiong

timeline.message:
Update setTip() method in FieldNameLabel.java

Change if statement to switch statement, which makes the code more understandable.

timeline.author: koppor
koppor
koppor
koppor

timeline.bodyText: Please move the else if one line up.
timeline.author: koppor

replies.bodyText: I'll do it now
replies.author: ShikunXiong

timeline.bodyText: I would not refer to an external document (e.g. "described in the LaTeX book"), which is not properly accessible. In my opinion, more (and local) information is better than the need of looking it up somewhere else. I see self-contained information where one needs it as the key. (If more information gets added to the tooltips, maybe the information could be structured in sections, split with new lines.)
timeline.author: systemoperator

replies.bodyText:
I would set quotation marks as well, when some specific syntax is addressed:
E.g. change are separated with the and keyword to are separated with the "and" keyword
replies.author: systemoperator

replies.bodyText:
I would not refer to an external document (e.g. "described in the LaTeX book"), which is not properly accessible. In my opinion, more (and local) information is better than the need of looking it up somewhere else. I see self-contained information where one needs it as the key. (If more information gets added to the tooltips, maybe the information could be structured in sections, split with new lines.)

Yes, thank you for your comment. I have the exact same feeling for these tips, I think that the context for each tip could be improved. I read those official documents, but I don't know how to summarize it properly.
replies.author: ShikunXiong

replies.bodyText:
I would set quotation marks as well, when some specific syntax is addressed:
E.g. change are separated with the and keyword to are separated with the "and" keyword

This is better. Thanks!
replies.author: ShikunXiong

replies.bodyText:
Yes, thank you for your comment. I have the exact same feeling for these tips, I think that the context for each tip could be improved. I read those official documents, but I don't know how to summarize it properly.

I agree, this is not an easy task. Let's collaboratively see, how they can be improved. :)
replies.author: systemoperator

replies.bodyText:
Can't we use the texts from our help page? --> https://docs.jabref.org/fields#standard-bibtex-fields
In case these text could be improved, feel free to submit a pull request.
I would say, the text for author can be improved ^^.
replies.author: koppor

replies.bodyText: Oh, another nice resource for additional information! :)
replies.author: systemoperator

timeline.bodyText: Currently, tooltips are only added for five fields (author, journal, title, year and key). It would be really great, if the other fields (e.g. in the other tabs of the entry editor) would get tooltips as well. Examples: date, editor, DOI, pages, number, language, volume, urldate, ...
timeline.author: systemoperator

replies.bodyText: Yes, what I made is just a start.
replies.author: ShikunXiong

replies.bodyText: This is really good to hear! Thank you for your effort! :)
replies.author: systemoperator
